column4: i put in a dvd to copy it and click on disc copy and specify the hp burner as the source and write to drive and it wont give me the copy button
its just sitting now with the copy button grayed out
ive tried dvds and an audio disc. no luck
its never done this
ive copied dvds before without trouble
yes but it acts the same
i was able to copy a dvd by inserting the dvd and right clicking and selecting copy disc without using brasero
i dont have a different machine handy
to do by right clicking on the dvd icon on the desktop took about 15 minutes total
i dont wanna spend that kind of time on every dvd i decide to copy
Perhaps nautilus-actions and throw in there the commands to copy DVD?
You don't see Random Port in Transmission Preferences/Settings?
Take a screenshot.
You're using Hardy Heron LTS (Long-Term Support) which is excellent for large businesses/institutions who does not wish to deploy every 6 months.  It is not old, but it is very stable.
You can install Transmission PPA which will enable you to obtain Transmission 1.76 (instead of whatever version you're on now).
ok so is there an easy update transmission? and if i instead use deluge what should i do with transmission?
Deluge / Transmission / Vuze / rTorrent are all torrenting client. You are to do what you want with. I can supply you with easy way to update.
Close Transmissions. Open a terminal and run "sudo add-apt-repository ppa:transmissionbt/ppa && sudo aptitude update && sudo aptitude upgrade" -- That is it.
It is not complicated. What airtonix and I suggest is that you include the new PPA repo for transmission to be upgraded.

---> echo "deb http://ppa.launchpad.net/transmissionbt/ubuntu hardy main" | sudo tee -a /etc/apt/sources.list.d/transmissionbt-ppa-hardy.list && sudo apt-key adv --recv-keys --keyserver keyserver.ubuntu.com 365C5CA1 && sudo aptitude update && sudo aptitude upgrade && echo Done\! \>\:\}\~
Correct.
